clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Chiglitazar Compare With Sitagliptin in Type 2 Diabetes Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Phase III Study of Chiglitazar in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus and Insufficient Glycemic Control Despite Diet and Exercise -- A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, and Sitagliptin-Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Chiglitazar, compare with Sitagliptin.

detailed_description.textblock: The efficacy and safety will be compared between Chiglitazar and Sitagliptin after treatment of 24 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c from baseline after 24 weeks of treatment
primary_outcome.description: The change of HbA1c at week 24 from baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c from baseline for patients with a baseline HbA1c >=8.5%
secondary_outcome.description: The change of HbA1c at week 24 from baseline for patients with a HbA1c >=8.5% at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c from baseline for patients with a baseline HbA1c <8.5%
secondary_outcome.description: The change of HbA1c at week 24 from baseline for patients with a HbA1c < 8.5% at baseline
The change of HbA1c at week 12 from baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients that attained target HbA1c <7.0%
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients whose HbA1c at week 24 are < 7.0%

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients whose HbA1c lowered by at least 0.5%
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients whose change of HbA1c at week 24d from baseline are >= 0.5%
